ygData.subject: Re: Staff of Writhing (SOW)
ygData.msgSnippet: below 35 better not go there. the zone edge is always full of ppl. only very high lvl go deep in ... From: LKW  To:
ygData.messageBody:
below 35 better not go there. the zone edge is always full of ppl. only very
high lvl go deep in
----- Original Message -----
From: LKW <leekw13@...>
To: <sg-everquest@onelist.com>
Sent: Thursday, September 02, 1999 09:01
Subject: RE: [sg-everquest] Staff of Writhing (SOW)


> From: LKW <leekw13@...>
>
> Hmm, given that the kobold noble is near zone, when we pull, other than
the
> 2 greater kobolds, will there be anymore minor gob (green to us but hit
> hard) joining them to form a train?
>
> Can u also give us the lvl for the greater kobold, solusek kobold and
> koblod noble?
>
>
>
> On Tuesday, 31 August, 1999 11:03 AM, Diablo
[SMTP:diablo99@...]
> wrote:
> > From: "Diablo" <diablo99@...>
> >
> > Staff of Writhing is not deep in Sol B
> >
> > Its pretty near the zone (from lavastorm, not from sol a) so just get a
> monk
> > to pull it then fight near zone.
> >
> > At his spawn spot will either be a Solusek kobold or the kobold noble
> (which
> > holds the staff of writhing)
> >
> > And when pulled, 2 more greater kobolds will come.
> >
> > Kobold Noble carries Staff of Writhing (common) and petrified erudite
> heart
> > pendant (rare).
> >
> > and if you have a party of 35... not very wise to camp shimmering orb.
> the
> > froglok scryer prolly has only about 400hp or so and is about level
22...
> >
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: Cheng Shan Chieh, Freddy <sccheng@...>
> > To: <sg-everquest@onelist.com>
> > Sent: Tuesday, August 31, 1999 9:29 AM
> > Subject: Re: [sg-everquest] One more thing.
> >
> >
> > > From: "Cheng Shan Chieh, Freddy" <sccheng@...>
> > >
> > > from what i know Staff of Withering is in Sol B... deep in Sol... u
> need a
> > > party of 35s to camp for it.... if u have a party of 35... may as well
> > camp
> > > for the Shimmering Orb....
> > >
> > > thast all i know,
> > > Nic
> > > ----- Original Message -----
> > > From: LKW <leekw13@...>
> > > To: <sg-everquest@onelist.com>
> > > Sent: Monday, August 30, 1999 7:21 PM
> > > Subject: RE: [sg-everquest] One more thing.
> > >
> > >
> > > > From: LKW <leekw13@...>
> > > >
> > > > Just to add, with high spec skill, u regain casting when u kena hit
> and
> > > > disturbed. Come to think of it, now I'm not very keen in getting
> SOO,
> > esp
> > > > need 1 hand to hold glowing stein. I think getting a writhing staff
> > plus
> > > > stein is much better than SOO alone. SOW give chaotic feedback, a
> base
> > > dam
> > > > plus lvl dam spell. Knn at lvl 50, u got like 80 dam per hit, wowo,
> > > better
> > > > than our wimpy 38 dd 'melee' spell, hehe.
> > > >
> > > > Any info on getting SOW? Is it very deep in Sol? What lvl party is
> > needed
> > > > etc? That CB Maquis get SOW at lvl 30, solo, must be KSing...
> > > >
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > On Monday, 30 August, 1999 3:59 PM, Leshrec
> [SMTP:leshrec@...]
> > > > wrote:
> > > > > From: "Leshrec" <leshrec@...>
> > > > >
> > > > > Yeah I agree that erudite makes the best wiz if you don't have
> money
> > > > > problems, since high level wiz DON'T melee at all, our staffs hit
> for
> > > max
> > > > 10
> > > > > damage and maybe 20 if staff of observers, Now why would we do
that
> if
> > > we
> > > > > can hit for 38 damage a pop using lower level spells. Erudites
also
> > have
> > > > > very high int, the other day i was at erudin and heard they
> boasting
> > > > about
> > > > > having 200int... I myself with all the int barang barang only
> > > 160int...In
> > > > > fact, agility and dex don't become important anymore at high level
> for
> > > > wiz
> > > > > unless you intend to tank them yourself =) As for concerning
> regaining
> > > > > concentration after getting hit, even if you dex high, high level
> > > > monsters
> > > > > hit u few times also die, not much difference...
> > > > > Leshrec
> > > > > -----Original Message-----
> > > > > From: LKW <leekw13@...>
> > > > > To: 'sg-everquest@onelist.com' <sg-everquest@onelist.com>
> > > > > Date: Monday, August 30, 1999 1:30 PM
> > > > > Subject: RE: [sg-everquest] One more thing.
> > > > >
> > > > >
> > > > > >From: LKW <leekw13@...>
> > > > > >
> > > > > >Oh oh, u must also know this.... ;)
> > > > > >
> > > > > >FYI, at high lvl, we wiz use mid-lvl spells for "melee" - like
Les
> > and
> > > > me,
> > > > > >one hand hold Black Book with Silver Rune, the other holding
> Glowing
> > > > Stein,
> > > > > >where got time for STA, DEX and AGI? Hehe. U can also buy a
> > coldstone
> > > > from
> > > > > >magi and put it in ya ammo slot - got ultravision liao. PLUS,
the
> > fact
> > > > > >that u can bank tat coldstone using the bag trick and hold it
> > > > > >forever...simi is ultravision huh? Easy lah, hehe.
> > > > > >
> > > > > >So in the end, Erudite wiz still the most powerful nuker. And
due
> to
> > > > the
> > > > > >coldstone thing, gnome wiz is still better than DE wiz, they got
> even
> > > > > >higher DEX and AGI, plus they can do tinkering...no forgetting
> gnome
> > > and
> > > > > >dwarf r the only true neutral races in EQ which wont get KOS from
> any
> > > > race
> > > > > >from the start and can use bank/shop services in all good races
> > cities.
> > > > ;)
> > > > > >
> > > > > >Ziltus
> > > > > >
> > > > > >
> > > > > >On Monday, 30 August, 1999 12:01 PM, Cheng Shan Chieh, Freddy
> > > > > >[SMTP:sccheng@...] wrote:
> > > > > >> hehe.. one more thing...
> > > > > >> ziltus u must hear this.. Dark Elf with max INT into it is 134
> and
> > 80
> > > > on
> > > > > >STA... they also have high DEX and AGI... so i think they are
> better
> > > > than
> > > > > >gnome n erudite since they also have utravision.
> > > > > >>
> > > > > >> thast all for now.. hehe...
